Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery commodity jar, the fabric is partially grey in section, exterior covered with a red-brown lip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text, with three incised grooves above.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/49 The Great Temple,The Sanctuary
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3:20, pl.97, no.316.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393474) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393474)
